name: Darkamor
description:
Darkamor is an upcoming 2.5D action side-scrolling game by Retrovision Games and developed by a single developer. It features the aesthetic beauty and shock value of 80s horror anime like Doomed Megalopolis. Inspired by classic retro titles like Castlevania and Strider. 

The Story So Far

Two rivals with different beliefs of justice must stop the evil that plagues their life. Sofia, the daughter of an aristocrat whose newly found power awakens when the evil warlock Darkamor raids her homeland and seeks the destruction of their family. At the same time, Daniel, a disgraced swordsman seeks revenge against the two of them for ruining his life.

Play as Sofia who used witchcraft or as Daniel a powerful swordsman that used dark magic alongside the cursed sword. Both of them have their own unique set of abilities that they will use in different situations in the game. Some of them are used to take a different route, some are for battle tactics, and more. Beating the game will unlock more playable characters. A beautiful bounty hunter and an assassin.

Planned Future Features: 
  • A wide world to explore ranging from something beautiful such as the abandoned rural town of Rosfield  to the chaotic dystopian modern world
  • Beautiful landscapes are drawn to imitate Studio Ghibli and 80s animes like Ghost in the Shell, Akira, and Doomed Megalopolis
  • Build your relationship with others so they will aid you in your journey to defeat the Master thru a hybrid-like visual novel sequence 
  • Changeable Music Mode (Genesis) 
  •  Video Filters (CRT)
  •  Gamepad Support (Xbox and Playstation) 
  •  Anime cutscene 
  •  Unlockable Content: New Playable Characters after beating the game, a Music Box, Collectable Gallery, and more
  • Multilingual Support
  • Up to 6 hours of map exploration    
  • An Opening Anime Intro
  • Features the music of Souichi Sakagami
  • Behind The Scenes
  • A 2.5D Environment similar to Strider 2 on PSX
Notes
  • Some of the translations are not accurate because of the usage of Google Translate
  • The demo of this game is scheduled to be released on: September 2, 2023
